patterns.pattern: on click call alert('You clicked me!')

on click if true log 'Clicked!'
             on mouseenter log 'Mouse entered!'
on click set x to 10 then log x
on click increment :x then put it into the next <output/>
on click increment @my-attr then put it into the next <output/>
on click increment :x then put result into the next <output/>
on click increment :x then put the result into the next <output/>

on click increment :x
              if :x <= 3
                put :x into the next <output/>
              else
                put '3 is the max...' into the next <output/>
              end

on click increment :x
                if :x < 3
                  put :x into the next <output/>
                otherwise
                  put '3 is the max...' into the next <output/>

on click set error to functionCouldReturnError()
                log error unless no error
on click toggle .red unless I match .bordered

on click
               get the (value of the next <input/>) as an Int
               increment it
               put it into the next <output/>

on click queue all
                    increment :count
                    wait 1s then put it into the next <output/>
on mousedown(button) put the button into the next <output/>
on click send foo to the next <output/>
on click trigger bar on the next <output/>

on foo put 'I got a foo event!' into me
           on bar put 'I got a bar event!' into me
on click send showMessage(message:'Foo!') to the next <output/>
on click send showMessage(message:'Bar!') to the next <output/>
on showMessage(message) put `The message '${message}' was sent to me` into me
on mutation of anything increment :mutationCount then put it into the next <output/>

on intersection(intersecting) having threshold 0.5
          if intersecting transition opacity to 1
          else transition opacity to 0

on intersection(intersecting) having threshold 0.5
         if intersecting transition opacity to 1
         else transition opacity to 0
init transition my opacity to 100% over 3 seconds
on click set my innerHTML to 'Clicked!'
on click put 'Clicked!' into my innerHTML
on click toggle the *display of the next <p/>

on click
               hide me
               wait 2s
               show me

on click
               hide me with *opacity
               wait 2s
               show me with *opacity

on keyup show <li/> in #color-list
                     when its innerHTML contains my value

on click transition my *font-size to 30px
               then wait 2s
               then transition my *font-size to initial
on click add .red then settle then remove .red

on click measure my top then
                    put `My top is ${top}` into the next <output/>

on click get my *computed-width
                    put `My width is ${the result}` into the next <output/>

on click fetch /clickedMessage then
                    put the result into the next <output/>

on click
              go to the top of the body smoothly
              wait 2s
              go to the bottom of me smoothly
on click go to url https://htmx.org

on click put 'Started...' into the next <output/>
                      wait for a continue   -- wait for a continue event...
                      put 'Finished...' into the next <output/>
                      wait 2s
                      put '' into the next <output/>
on click send continue to the previous <button/>

on click put 'Started...' into the next <output/>
                    wait for a continue or 3s   -- wait for a continue event...
                    if the result's type is 'continue'
                      put 'Finished...' into the next <output/>
                    otherwise
                      put 'Timed Out...' into the next <output/>
                    end
                    wait 2s
                    put '--' into the next <output/>

on click repeat until event stop
                    add .pulse then settle
                    remove .pulse then settle
on click send stop to the previous <button/>
on click async call returnsAPromise() put 'I called it...' into the next <output/>
on click call alert('Hello from JavaScript!')
init js alert('Hello from JavaScript!') end
on click js return 'Success!' end then put it into my.innerHTML
on click set foo to 1 js(foo) alert('Adding 1 to foo: '+(foo+1)) end
on click call Incrementer.increment(41) then put 'The answer is: ' + it into my.innerHTML

on click
  tell next <output/>
    breakpoint
    put 'You can click <kbd><samp>Step Over</samp></kbd> to execute the command' into you
    put 'Click the <kbd><samp>⤷</kbd></samp> button to skip to a command'   into you
    put 'Click <kbd><samp>Continue</samp></kbd> when you’re done'                into you
    put '--'                                                                     into you
set $foo to 10 -- sets a global named $foo
set :bar to 20 -- sets an element scoped variable named :bar
set x to {name : "Joe", age: 35}    -- create an object with some properties
log x's name                        -- access the name property using a possessive
get the first <div/> then          -- get the first div in the DOM, setting the `results` variable
set my innerHTML to its innerHTML  -- use possessive expressions to set the current elements innerHTML
log the name of x                   -- access the name property using an of expression
set allDivs to <div/>                      -- get all divs
set allParents to the parent of allDivs    -- get all parents of those divs as an array
set allChildren to the children of allDivs -- get all children of those divs as an array
log example.prop     -- logs null, because `example` is null
make a URL from "/path/", "https://origin.example.com" called myURL
make an <a.navlink/> then put it after me
log the first of myArr  -- logs "1"
log the last of myArr   -- logs "3"
log random in myArr     -- logs a random element from the array
set lens to strs.map( \ s -> s.length )
put '3 is the max...' into the next <output/>
put '3 is the max...' into the next <output/>">
append " world"  -- append " world" to the result
log it           -- log it to the console
get the (value of the next <input/>) as an Int
get the nextInteger() then log it -- using the 'it' alias for 'result`
wait 1s then put it into the next <output/>">
add .highlight to the first <p/> in me
put `My top is ${top}` into the next <output/>">
put `My width is ${the result}` into the next <output/>">
put the result into the next <output/>">
wait for a continue   -- wait for a continue event...
wait for a continue or 3s   -- wait for a continue event...
tell the runtime _not_ to synchronize on a value.
put 'You can click <kbd><samp>Step Over</samp></kbd> to execute the command' into you
put 'Click the <kbd><samp>⤷</kbd></samp> button to skip to a command'   into you
put 'Click <kbd><samp>Continue</samp></kbd> when you’re done'                into you
on click put 'Clicked!' into (<p/> in me).innerHTML
on click set world to 'hyperscript' put 'Hello $world' into my innerHTML
on click fetch /example then put it into my innerHTML
on click fetch /example then put `result: ${the result}` into my innerHTML
on click put the window's location into me
on click put window.location into me

on click from body in <a/>
          put its @href into me
          halt -- prevent the default
on click put 'The answer was $waitThenReturn10()' into my.innerHTML
on click wait 2s then put 'I waited!' into my.innerHTML
on click reload() the location of the window
on click log the closest parent <div/>
on click add .focused to the next <div.header/>
set divs to -- get all divs in the document
set divParents to divs.parentElement    -- get all parents of those divs
set divChildren to divs.children        -- get all children of those divs
set cookies.myCookie to 'foo'     # sets the cooke 'myCookie' to the value true, forever
set cookies['myCookie'] to 'bar'  # updates the previous cookies value
on click transition opacity to 0 then remove me

on click
             fetch /clickedMessage/
             put the result into #fetch-target-3

on keyup debounced at 300ms
            put my.value into #debounce-target-3
Make an element visible by setting the `display` style to `block`
on htmx:afterRequest wait 2s then put '' into #messages
on load wait 2s then remove me
on load wait 2s then transition my opacity to 0 then remove me
Wait a second! I can hear you screaming.  That's going to clear *all* the messages, what if you want them
